recommendations: STAT serum creatinine, BUN, and electrolytes (including potassium) are required to calculate eGFR before any contrast administration.
If eGFR is sufficient (>= 45 mL/min/1.73m²), proceed with CT Pulmonary Angiography (CT_CHEST_ANGIO_PULMONARY_EMBOLISM) with weight-based low-osmolar iodinated contrast.
If eGFR is < 30 mL/min/1.73m², avoid iodinated contrast and consider a ventilation-perfusion (V/Q) scan or MR pulmonary angiography.
Re-evaluate the indication for low-dose CT chest screening; it is not currently indicated based on available patient data.

protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~100–150 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ensure contrast-to-eGFR ratio <1.1 g/(mL/min); if eGFR <30, consider non-contrast alternatives or weigh risks carefully.
